intro: Gagea lutea f. banatica, commonly known as the Banat golden bulb, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its bulbous root system and grass-like foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers during the spring season. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Due to its ornamental value and rarity, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
